title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather and document the project requirements, objectives, constraints, and success criteria for designing and simulating biocomputers using engineered cellular components for parallel processing and low-energy computation. This should include defining the desired functionality, performance targets, scalability requirements, and any specific constraints or assumptions related to the biological components and computational models. Additionally, consider the following aspects: (1) Identify the target applications or problem domains where biocomputers could provide significant advantages over traditional computing systems. (2) Determine the level of accuracy and fidelity required for simulating biological processes and interactions. (3) Establish guidelines for integrating biological data and models from various sources. (4) Define the expected outputs and visualizations for the simulations. (5) Outline the required expertise and collaboration with domain experts (e.g., biologists, computer scientists, engineers). (6) Define the evaluation criteria and metrics to assess the performance and accuracy of the simulations. (7) Identify potential risks, challenges, and mitigation strategies related to the complexity of biological systems and the integration of diverse data sources. (8) Determine the timeline for each phase of the project, including milestones and deadlines. (9) Identify any resource requirements, such as hardware, software, or personnel. (10) Define the process for handling changes or updates to the project scope during development. (11) Include a section on ethical considerations and guidelines related to the use of engineered cellular components and data privacy. (12) Consider the long-term scalability of the project and potential future improvements or extensions.

title: Research Biocomputer Architecture
description: Conduct a comprehensive literature review and research on existing biocomputer architectures, parallel processing techniques, and low-energy computation methods using engineered cellular components.

title: Design Biocomputer Architecture (RFC Approved)
description: Based on the research findings, design and document the proposed biocomputer architecture. This includes: 1) outlining the cellular components, 2) explaining parallel processing mechanisms, 3) detailing low-energy computation strategies, 4) illustrating data flow, 5) describing control mechanisms, 6) identifying potential applications, 7) considering scalability and fault tolerance, 8) providing an overview of the architecture design (to be detailed further in subsequent tasks), and 9) addressing any possible concerns or challenges that might arise during implementation. This task is currently IN_PROGRESS, assigned to code-architect with a priority of 3. The dependencies include 'Research Biocomputer Architecture'. Once completed, please update the 'implementation_state' field and assign the task to an appropriate team member for further development.

title: Develop Simulation Framework
description: Create a simulation framework or platform to model and simulate the designed biocomputer architecture, including the cellular components, parallel processing, and low-energy computation.

title: Implement Biocomputer Simulation
description: Implement the biocomputer simulation within the developed framework, incorporating the designed architecture, cellular components, parallel processing mechanisms, and low-energy computation strategies.

title: Validate and Test Simulation
description: Validate the biocomputer simulation by testing various scenarios, benchmarking performance, and verifying the accuracy and correctness of the simulation results.

title: Optimize Biocomputer Architecture
description: Based on the simulation results and performance benchmarks, optimize the biocomputer architecture for improved parallel processing and low-energy computation.

title: Document and Report Findings
description: Prepare a comprehensive report documenting the biocomputer architecture design, simulation framework, implementation details, performance results, and optimization strategies.
